description.value:
While you're hidden from a creature, that creature knows the space you're in but can't tell precisely where you are. You typically become hidden by using Stealth to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Hide]{Hide}. When @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Seek]{Seeking} a creature using only imprecise senses, it remains hidden, rather than @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Observed]{Observed}. A creature you're hidden from is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} to you, and it must succeed at a 1d20 DC 11 flat check when targeting you with an attack, spell, or other effect or it fails affect you. Area effects aren't subject to this flat check.

A creature might be able to use the seek action to try to observe you, as described on page 471.
